title: Urgot Ult is the Biggest Fuck you to Healing/shielding
body:
And i love it

thank you ~~certainlyt~~ Repertoir

replies.body: Although I wonder if Urgot being stunned or suppressed mid-execute cancels....hmm....
It doesn't sound like it because they said "The effect can only be ended by killing Urgot"
and urgot never truly dies because he lives here ' places hand on chest '
Places hand in pantaloons

So he lives between the bewbs?
all the boob
i think repertoir did urgot, actually

Gameplay Design-side, it was mainly BelugaWhale and me, actually.

That said, Urgot's kit is actually highly thematically and artistically driven, so it's important to cal out that there is much more design that goes into the update than just gameplay.

Alright Repertoir, i'll always remember this rework you made as a good rework
i didn't think you were able to do a good job after quinn malz kog garen skarner
It's really relieving to get this stamp of approval.
Didn't you do Taric? You'll always have that gem.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2EguPi6k,comment-id=00030001,timestamp=2017-07-08T02:26:23.203+0000)
>

> 
> That said, Urgot's kit is actually highly thematically and artistically driven, so it's important to cal out that there is much more design that goes into the update than just gameplay.

As should all VGU's.
Most of them have outdated kits but strong thematic appeal so it's only logical that they should be molded to fit those fantasies!

Also, great job on Urgot, he really is the monstrosity we've all been waiting for.
Thanks, but we'll see how it goes. At this point, all we really know is that the publishing crew is doing a good job so far.

I do have a note...from the video, is his kit supposed to seem like a shorter ranged Graves? {{champion:104}} 

The ultimate execute is indeed unique, especially with the seeming "erasure" of the corpse, but when you look at it, his kit now seems very similar to graves.  He has a dash, now non-spammable Q which allocates a lot of his damage.  He kept the shield(and seemingly gained a gatling gun from what I remember),  but it seems as though a lot of his damage will be from short-ranged shotgun bursts that are instead situational and wider than Graves

though if you look even further, their ultimates have about the same range except that graves offers instant damage and if i'm judging properly, a slightly larger range compared to the "death blender" and its hook.  To vary this comparison even further,  Graves has an area of effect ultimate, but except for Urgot's new Q, urgot has to position in crazy manners to achieve effectiveness.

It seems like this will bare the same problem as fiora and gangplank, where when a player gets good, there is no escaping the onslaught of damage and the "mini game" instead becomes annoying as it distracts from the focus of the lane and the battles at hand

Any insight on this?

His passive is supposed to have a similar feel to Graves' autos, but I don't think anything feels very similar beyond that.

As opposed to Fiora and GP, I think it feels less game-y after the lane ends, because he tends to turn on W early and put them all on cooldown pretty quickly, so tracking them individually isn't as important as it is in the lane. You can mostly just assume he has them when the fight starts, and doesn't a few seconds later. Individuals' mileage may vary, however, as far as how much mindshare it's taking up.

correct me if im wrong but does the champion model that urgot eats/execute disappear after? 
cause that would be incrediable
I believe so.
could it leave a pool of blood? or have a special death animation for champs killed by it
Just play Vlad.

How your post looked like
_Good day sir, do you have time to talk about our lord and donor Vlad?_
All my posts are like that, even when I'm not talking about Vlad.
And this isn't just for the forums either.

The corpse vanishing because he ground it up is awesome. Could we see the same thing happen to Cho'gath's Feast when he gets his rework? I know it already removes the bodies of small champs like yordles, but it would be nice to see it on all champs.

Also the Urgot rework has me so excited, while I don't play him much anymore Urgot was actually the first champion I picked up and wanted to main.

Thank you for giving the Urgod the respect he deserves. We are all but maggots compared to the glory and might of the Urgod, and now he has the tools to properly put every other champ is their place. 

http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/facebook/000/077/988/my_body_is_ready.png

repertoir was at least partially involved so yeah, i'm at least a little bit right

CertainlyT redeeming himself with those amazing reworks, Warwick's rework was a masterpiece, Urgot's rework seems to be a  masterpiece as well.

#If you are reading this CertainlyT, We love you.
CertainlyT be like: Lol bitchez, as if I care what you think, I know I'm good.
As long as he isn't designing champs, we good.
I am gonna love seeing Urgot ulting a 1hp Trynda. Perfect counter.
how does that work? tryndamere cant die to anything under ult.
The fountain laser can kill him.
A rioter said the ult does true damage equal to the target's maximum health plus some for leeway. True dmage doesn't kill Tryndamere so this Urgot ult wouldn't either.

You reactivate the ultimate manually.
So, when Tryndamere is ulting, use the ultimate on him so the timer doesn't run out before his ultimate.
Then reactivate the ultimate and see that poor Tryndamere getting pulled back to you in despair.
How long will the reactivation portion last? Until their dead?
about 5 seconds, then the drill disappears
In the video there seemed to be about a 4 second window where you could reactivate it. I timed it.
It's always leeway. Can you please stop shoving your poster boy down our throats. WE'VE HAD ENOUGH OF LEE HERE.
Rip to the catfish tahm. He shield wont save him from the Urgod
As an avid Tahm player, that's not the bad thing, it's that I can't save anyone that gets grabbed by his ult since they're untargetable.
The chains should pull tahm too if he eats a low HP ally, like urgot is fishing.

Mechanically, shaky logic. The wording can be changed, though. Please make this happen. This is an amazing idea from a thematic standpoint.

And actually from a gameplay perspective it could be a really interesting interaction. Urgot makes a pick, but Tahm latches on and uses it to engage! He flashes behind Urgot while his own poor carry is ground to dust behind him, then stands on Urgot's ADC's face with stuns and omnomns! Ooor flipped the other way, poor Tahm dies to the ult that had originally targeted the one he hate. The catfish sacrifices his life save his one true carry. Jhin cradles Tahm's dying giblets in his arms, weeping.

{{champion:202}}: "How could this happen? Why? Why? Why? Why, Tahm!? It should've been me! Now you rest in bits - in too many pieces! My love, you did not deserve this fate. My demon catfish cinnamon roll, too pure and good for this world. I swear revenge in the rain. I will avenge you! They will not go unpunished! Such an ugly death for you - this travesty to art cannot stand unanswered!"

Such romance!

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}

(... got a little off-track there...)
Rito make this interaction happen please
Why tho? o

why what?

if the animation of his ult goes off and the target's hp goes above 25% it still dies


i love it, counters so many champions *cough mundo*
Well.. kind of, but its a skillshot and they need to be at low hp first to activate it.
